diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Pallister–Hall syndrome with hypothalamic hamartoma and Rathke cleft cyst
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient, a 12-year-old girl with a known genetic diagnosis of Pallister–Hall syndrome, presented with refractory epilepsy and underwent brain MRI, which revealed two significant midline lesions: a hypothalamic hamartoma and a Rathke cleft cyst. The diagnosis was confirmed by subsequent resection and pathological studies demonstrating the characteristics of both lesions.
